etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Insect Life. From scientific Latin Hippobosca, genus name (LinnaeusSystema naturae (ed. 10, 1758) II. 607; from hippo- + ancient Greek βόσκειν to feed) + -id, after scientific Latin Hippoboscidae, family name

definitions: Any member of (or insect formerly included in) the dipteran family Hippoboscidae, which includes the keds and other bloodsucking flies parasitic on birds and mammals.

notes.text: Also called forest fly, louse fly, spider fly.

definitions: Designating this family of flies; of or relating to this family of flies.
